Package org.bff.javampd.server

Interface ServerStatus

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MPDServerStatus
    public interface ServerStatus
    ServerStatus represents the server's status at the time it is called. The status has a default expiry interval of 5 seconds. This can be overridden by using setExpiryInterval(long). You can also force an update from the server by calling forceUpdate()
    Author:
    bill

      • setExpiryInterval

        void setExpiryInterval​(long seconds)
        Sets the length of time that the status is considered expired. Set to 0 to always call the server
        Parameters:
        seconds - the number of seconds before the loaded status is considered expired

      • forceUpdate

        void forceUpdate()
        Forces a server update

      • isConsume

        boolean isConsume()
        Returns if the player is in consuming mode. If true, each song played is removed from playlist.
        Returns:
        true if the player is in consuming mode.

      • isSingle

        boolean isSingle()
        Returns if the player plays a single track. If true, activated, playback is stopped after current song, or song is repeated if the 'repeat' mode is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the player plays a single track;

      • getMixRampDb

        Optional<Integer> getMixRampDb()
        The threshold at which songs will be overlapped. Like crossfading but doesn’t fade the track volume, just overlaps.
        Returns:
        the threshold at which songs will be overlapped. Like crossfading but doesn’t fade the track volume, just overlaps.

      • getMixRampDelay

        Optional<Integer> getMixRampDelay()
        Additional time subtracted from the overlap calculated by mixrampdb.
        Returns:
        additional time subtracted from the overlap calculated by mixrampdb
